intro: Gymnosporia peglerae, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, woody fruits called cypselae. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Gymnosporia peglerae is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
